name: extrinsically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that comes from outside, or is not related to someone or something: Workers who feel that they are being controlled extrinsically often feel demotivated. When considering a plagiarism claim, a judge must look at whether the two texts are extrinsically similar.
More examplesFewer examplesSome people have challenged the idea of performance-related pay, because many employees are intrinsically rather than extrinsically motivated.When we value something extrinsically, we don't value it for its own sake, but for some other reason.The company offers a range of incentives to motivate its staff extrinsically.
